column4: I tried to install Ubuntu for a friend and it didn't work... now their computer won't boot
I tried to reinstall and it rejects the CD ... what should I do?
errr, it crashes when I try to reinstall
I don't want to tell them tomorrow morning that I hozed their computer, what do I do?
I tried to install Ubuntu for a friend and it didn't work... now their computer won't boot
I don't want to tell them tomorrow morning that I hozed their computer, what do I do?
how does it not boot?
it says error loading operating system, I assume that's a grub problem
at what point does the error occur? does the grub menu come up?
no grub menu... I don't think
does it even say "loading GRUB" or anything like that?
I don't think it did... I'm on the liveCD now so it would take a while to verify, but I'm pretty sure that it didn't
is it booting from the right hard drive
I think there's only one hard-drive
so assuming it's booting from the right hard-drive, and that it doesn't get to GRUB, what kind of problem am I looking at here??
i have no idea...i assume you partitioned it properly and installed correctly?
can you explain how you partitioned it
I used the automatic option,  let it split the disk in half as it does by default and then let it run
Then I tried again, to repartition that half and the liveCD just borked
i have no idea how the automatic partitioner works, but if there was a partition on it before it may have just killed it.  try reinstalling ubuntu and partitioning it manually?
I can try it again... if it fails again I'll just come back here.... actually.. since I'm at their house in Worcester on vacation... is there a loCo team for Massachussettes?
